Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2023
Author: Tiffany C.
Title: Not worth it
Body: Spend your money on something else. For $60, this sweats, spills, scratches easily, and does not keep water cold for long enough. I didn‚Äôt want to buy into the Stanley fad but this was the only bottle of this capacity that had a handle (small hands) and allowed me to use my own preferred straw. If you don‚Äôt fill it to the brim with ice, your water will be warm within a few hours. If you do fill it to the brim with ice, you will get about six hours of cold water (at least in air conditioning ‚Äì outside in the heat, forget about it) and all the ice makes it very heavy to carry around. I‚Äôve never had an insulated bottle that was this poor at keeping water cold, I think it‚Äôs too thin and needs an additional wall to trap the temperature. Lastly, I‚Äôve never had an insulated anything that sweats! Is that not the point of these things!? When I let the bottle sit in a room of about 75 degrees I can expect to come back and find it in a puddle. Ridiculous!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 16, 2023
Author: Skyelander
Title: I wanna get water wasted!
Body: Okay‚Ä¶. I don‚Äôt really want to get water wasted but I did buy this to increase my water intake. It sure helps to have this as I have noticed I am drinking more now than I had before. I really like the Stanley that I picked out. (30 oz size) It holds the temperature of my ice cold water even when I leave it in the car for hours on 90+ degree days. I am impressed by that for sure! I will say that I wish this was one of those bottles that I could throw in my bag but it is not. It will likely leak if it is on its side and guaranteed leak if it is upside down. Not a huge deal for me but something to mention. I do like that it has a handle so I can easily carry it around with all of my other endless amounts of junk. It is also easy to clean out with my scrub daddy sponge. Sometimes I throw it in the wash too although I‚Äôve heard mixed reviews about that. So far, no issues here. Also, this fits my car cup holders which is awesome!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2023
Author: tjp1684tjp1684
Title: Solid cup, worthwhile investment
Body: Whether I‚Äôm drinking my lukewarm coffee or an ice cold beverage, this is going to keep the temp all day long.  If I put ice in at 6 am, it‚Äôs going to be there in the afternoon when I get off.I had one, it got stolen, and I immediately replaced it.  A lot of cups got donated after we got these.If it tips over, liquid will spill out, so it‚Äôs not a secured cap like a Yeti.  What it does do better than Yeti is: 1.) Fit in car cup holders 2.) Have a handle that fits my hand.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 9, 2023
Author: "jbondbmw""jbondbmw"
Title: Paint chipping before first use
Body: The first time I took my brand new tumbler out of the cabinet to use, there was some chipped paint along the bottom of the cup. I submitted a warranty claim only to  be instantly told the warranty doesn't cover chipped paint. I can understand this for bottles that have been used for a while, but this was brand new never used. I'm very disappointed that they don't stand by their products,  especially for the price. I have other stainless steel tumblers from other companies and this Stanley is the first one to have the paint chip or crack. I will be buying my tumblers from other companies from now on. They are better quality and have better warranties and customer service.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2023
Author: jeannie roberts
Title: Doesnt keep ice
Body: Ive tried a million yeti-type cups and was surprised this didn't work as well as most. I jumped on the stanley bandwagon, i figured it was great since.. yanno..everyone has one! But my ice barely stays for 1/2 a day.  Im not a straw fan so the lid you can move and just drink out of the opening. Not easy to turn the lid part, you need both hands. And the water doesnt just flow out like a normal cup. I'm not a fan. Wish i would've kept my $$ on this one.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2023
Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Leaks and does not keep water cold
Body: I was very excited to try the Stanley cup. All my friends rave about it, but I am so disappointed. I don't use the straw, so I rotate the top closed when not in use. It leaks. It is not leakproof. I also add plenty of ice and it melts within an hour. It is does not keep liquids cold for anywhere near advertised. The other annoying thing is that it has a handle, which is theory, is nice, but not when your top need to be twisted on and you can't line up the drinking hole with the handle. I have tried every conceivable starting position when rotating the top, but it will just not get tight at the right location. Did I get a defective cup?

Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2023
Author: Sarah PhillipsSarah Phillips
Title: Great Deal!
Body: I am so glad I caught this great deal! $35 bucks for a cup that usually goes for $60+. A great deal. I‚Äôm so glad I purchased this i love it!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2023
Author: Constant Reader
Title: A Solid B+
Body: The coating/finish doesn‚Äôt seem to be as thick and durable as my Yeti, but it‚Äôs nice enough.  It should hold up well.  I love the 64 ounce size.  I can go my whole shift without having to refill it.  The length of time they claim this will hold ice seems a bit exaggerated but it keeps my drink ice cold for well over 24 to 36 hours which is more than enough for me since I reload it every day.  I took off a star because it leaks when you knock it over (that never happens with my yeti) but overall I‚Äôm very pleased with this purchase. Thanks Stanley!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
Author: Dionicia lindsay
Title: Keeps its cold
Body: Oh, the 30 oz Stanley Cup is a must-have for any hockey fan! It's a high-quality, stainless steel tumbler that keeps your drinks hot or cold for hours. The iconic design resembles the legendary Stanley Cup trophy, making it a fun and unique way to show off your love for the game. Whether you're sipping on your favorite hot beverage during the winter season or enjoying a refreshing cold drink at a summer BBQ, this tumbler is perfect for keeping your drink at the right temperature. It's durable, easy to clean, and definitely adds a touch of hockey flair to your drinkware collection. Cheers to that! üèíü•§üèÜ

Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 1, 2023
Author: Fantastic4
Title: No dents or scratches!!!!
Body: No complaints. I personally love Stanley‚Äôs. If you don‚Äôt have one I recommend this cup!!

Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on May 30, 2023
Author: StephKStephK
Title: Great cup but poor packaging
Body: Ordered this from USA as they are sold out in the uk.Took some time for them to dispatch it. But I think it took about 3weeks total to get here.I like the cup. Seems genuine enough (no expert there though)But I‚Äôm stunned how badly packed it was. Came in a paper bag mo cushioning. I expected it to be in a box.Because of this there is a little damage to the cup which I‚Äôm not happy about. But will keep as took long enough to get this one.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2024
Author: Barbara Orlowske
Title: Who repairs Stanley H20?
Body: Although this product excels at keeping items at desired temperature, I am very disappointed in the customer service available on this item.  Within a month of receiving, I accidentally dropped on the floor and it was full.  The handle broke off and when I tried to contact someone for support, Amazon website referred me to Stanley Tools, who says they have nothing to do with this product.  They did give me the web address of the correct company and I tried to contact them with no success.  I then sent an email to Amazon without any reply.  This is very unusual for Amazon as they always get back with an answer.  Guess I won't be buying another one of these!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 25, 2023
Author: Paulina GuzmanPaulina Guzman
Title: Great buy! Worth the price!
Body: I had been waiting for these to be re-stocked! So happy I found it on Amazon. The only bad thing is that it came with a tiny dent on the side, but honestly you can barely even see it. Other than that, 5 stars overall!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 23, 2024
Author: Annette Johnson
Title: I use it all the time!
Body: I'll admit, it's just a cup. But it's a very good cup, and I like the way it looks. It is leak proof enough that when I'm lying in bed and I want to take a sip, no water pours on me.It keeps my coffee hot long enough so then I can have some in the morning before my walk and some after my walk without it cooling at all.This isn't the best cup if you're going hiking or out on the town. But this is a great water bottle if you are working at a desk all day and you want to keep habitually drinking water throughout the day. Definitely recommend!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2023
Author: Maimouna Fall
Title: Really cute!
Body: I love this cup and I think the 30oz is the perfect size! Not too big or too small. Took off a star because it came with a little scatch.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2023
Author: KenKen
Title: Arrived in Perfect Condition
Body: I got lucky.  Stanley 30oz and Simple Modern 40oz arrived in perfect condition.  Love both brands. I drink cold beverages from a straw so either tumbler works great. Simple Modern has innovative screw lid so straw hole can be adjusted 4 ways.  It always lines up perfectly if you use your right or left hand.  Love these colors.

Title: Love Stanley cups, wish Amazon knew how to pack them
Body: I love all my Stanley cups but needed a bigger one for work. Like other comments have stated, the packing is terrible. I'm confused as to why $60 cups were packaged in a box WAY too big with no protection whatsoever. I hesitatantly ordered a replacement but will be requesting a refund if this one is banged up too.

I don't have time to reorder and it does have to be washed, however it just gives the feel of giving a used product that I paid full price for

I don‚Äôt have to think about it. I will definitely be purchasing a smaller one for coffee. Great purchase!

Title: Keeps water cold all day
Body: Got this Stanley for my husband for Christmas and he really likes it. Keeps his water really cold all day and night if he needs especially when you add ice. Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
Author: Terri Williams
Title: Great cup...however....
Body: I have the 30oz Stanley.  Love the handle, straw and the three position lid.  I really love the fact that it can go in the dishwasher.  However.....I gave four stars for one reason....I put ice and water in it and the ice melts down to almost nothing by the day's end.  I will put ice almost halfway up the cup at 10am and by 7pm, most of it has melted down to the narrow part at the bottom.  I am not putting in warm water just in case you wondered.  This is water from my fridge dispenser so it is cold already.  It is winter, so I am not leaving it out in the sun either.  My Yeti doesn't seem to allow the ice to melt as fast.  It is a nice cup though.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Not the greatest cup
Body: Bought this cup for my daughter because all the kids have it.  It's not great.  The top is very hard to get off, when you carry it by the handle it's tipped so water leaks out of the straw area, and then my daughter dropped it and the handle busted off.  The "lifetime warranty" doesn't cover it.  Only if the handle suddenly popped off by itself.  So it's not even made for durability.  Wont be spending that kind of money on another stanley.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2023
Author: KayT
Title: Disappointed
Body: Waited a while to jump on the bad wagon. Never really have I been disappointed before at this level. The cup is just okay, nothing fabulous about it at all. The two stars is because of the cost for what it‚Äôs giving. I have a cup I paid a fraction of the price for that is so much better. So Stanley knows the cup leaks and the solution is to make accessories/plugs? How much money does one company wish to make? Why can‚Äôt y‚Äôall redesign the lid and send everyone a new one? Just seems like if I have a cup for $12 that does not leak, clearly one for $50 can invest in the same technology. Really wish this was a fad I had skipped, so, so disappointed.
